thread.title: Jerry Falwell Jr. to lead Trump’s higher education task force
thread.title_full: Jerry Falwell Jr. to lead Trump’s higher education task force

author: ELIZABETH ELIZALDE
title: Jerry Falwell Jr. to lead Trump’s higher education task force
text:
Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. to lead Trump’s higher education task force Jerry Falwell Jr. to lead Trump’s higher education task force Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. with then Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump last January.    25 PM 
Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. said President Trump has tapped him to lead a task force to reform the U.S. Department of Education. 
He spoke with Steve Bannon, Trump’s chief strategist, Tuesday about the role and said details about it are the still being sorted out, according to the Associated Press. 
“The goal is to pare it back and give colleges and their accrediting agencies more leeway in governing their affairs,” Falwell told The Chronicle of Higher Education . 
A meeting to discuss the task force with Trump is scheduled for Wednesday, he said. 
Falwell strongly supported the President during his campaign and served on his Evangelical Executive Advisory Board to advise him on issues that mattered to Evangelicals and of other faiths in America. 
Trump also asked him to serve as Education Secretary, but Falwell said he declined the offer because he wanted a role that would allow him stay at Liberty University. 
He praised current education nominee Betsy DeVos – who is still awaiting Senate confirmation – as a good choice to head the department. Liberty University President Jerry Falwell Jr. has been tapped to head a presidential task force. (Steve Helber/AP) 
Falwell – the son of the late Rev. Jerry Falwell , evangelist and founder the Moral Majority – has served as Liberty University president since his father’s death in 2007. 
The younger Falwell made headlines when he alluded to killing Muslims in the wake of the San Bernardino shooting in December 2015. 
“If more good people had concealed-carry permits, then we could end those Muslims before they walked in and killed them,” he said. 
He encouraged Liberty University students to enroll in campus courses that would help them to obtain a conceal weapon permit. He also said he carries a weapon for protection. 
“Let’s teach them a lesson if they ever show up here,” Falwell added.
